result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy J Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to any sentence currently serving.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety. May not use/possess alcohol.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Attorney Laura Breun in court on behalf of defendant.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Laura Breun in court for Defendant Roy J Smith. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roy J Smith appeared by phone means.  Hearing regarding defense objection to restitution order.  Atty Breun argues defendant is objecting to proposed restitution order being filed about 35 days past the 90 day time frame to file restitution.  Ct. finds that filing 35 days past the 90 days does not cause any undue burden on the defendant.   Atty Breun objects to type of expenses on restitution order based on charge plead & sentenced on and makes argument for such. ADA Raymond provides rebuttal argument.  Ct. will accept state's submission of proposed restitution order. Ct. orders that money also does come from any prison funds.
to Produce
Restitution hearing on November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roy J Smith in court with attorney Laura Breun. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA Raymond files amended information - Ct. 1 amended to substantial battery (class I felony).  Copy given to defendant, reading waived.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of no contest to count 1.  Court accepted def's plea, found and adjudged defn guilty. Joint recommendation, 18 mos initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision.  This sentence to run consecutive to sentence defendant is currently serving.  Sentencing will be held on 4-12-2016 to comply with Chapter 950. Ct. orders bail revoked.
